question:
Which of the following statements are correct with respect to Lok adalats?
1. An award of a Lok Adalat shall be deemed to be a decree of a Civil Court.
2. Every award made by a Lok Adalat shall be final and binding on all the parties to the dispute.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: An award of a Lok Adalat is to be taken as a decree of a Civil Court or an order of any other court. Every award made by a Lok Adalat shall be final and binding on all the parties involved in the dispute. No appeal shall lie to any court against the award of the Lok Adalat.
